definition: to make advances to someone, usually with a proposal or suggestion, the act of drawing spatially closer to something
details:
verb
- to make advances to someone, usually with a proposal or suggestion
= example: to make advances to someone, usually with a proposal or suggestion
- to come near in time
= example: to come near in time
= synonyms: come near
- to move towards
= example: to move towards
= synonyms: near, go up, come on, draw close, come near, draw near
- to begin to deal with
= example: to begin to deal with
= synonyms: set about, go about
- to come near, resemble, come nearer in quality, or character
= example: to come near, resemble, come nearer in quality, or character
= synonyms: border on
noun
- the act of drawing spatially closer to something
= example: the act of drawing spatially closer to something
= synonyms: coming
- a relatively short golf shot intended to put the ball onto the putting green
= example: a relatively short golf shot intended to put the ball onto the putting green
= synonyms: approach shot
- ideas or actions intended to deal with a problem or situation
= example: ideas or actions intended to deal with a problem or situation
= synonyms: attack
- a way of entering or leaving
= synonyms: access
- a close approximation
= example: a close approximation
- the temporal property of becoming nearer in time
= example: the temporal property of becoming nearer in time
= synonyms: coming
- a tentative suggestion designed to elicit the reactions of others
= synonyms: advance
- the event of one object coming closer to another
= synonyms: approaching
- the final path followed by an aircraft as it is landing
= synonyms: approach path, glide path, glide slope
